questions.question: The electric charge or electrode deposition of one gram equivalent of a substance is:

answers.c: Charge on one mole of electrons

explanations.a: Too small. This is only 1 Coulomb.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Not equivalent to one Faraday.
explanations.c: Correct. One mole of electrons equals 96,500 C. See here
explanations.d: Incorrect unit. Itâ€™s 96,500 Coulombs total, not per second.

questions.question: What happens to the oxidizing agent in an oxidation-reduction reaction?

answers.a: It is reduced as it gains electrons
answers.b: It is oxidized as it gains electrons
answers.c: It is reduced as it loses electrons
answers.d: It is oxidized as it loses electrons

explanations.a: Correct. Oxidizing agents gain electrons and are reduced. More info
explanations.b: Gaining electrons is reduction, not oxidation.
explanations.c: Losing electrons is oxidation, not reduction.
explanations.d: This is true for reducing agents, not oxidizing agents.

questions.question: Which of the following is true for an electrolytic cell?

answers.b: Electrons flow through the salt bridge
answers.c: An electric current is produced by a chemical reaction
answers.d: A nonspontaneous reaction is forced to occur

explanations.a: Electrons actually flow toward the cathode.
explanations.b: Salt bridge allows ion flow, not electrons.
explanations.c: This is true for galvanic cells, not electrolytic cells.
explanations.d: Correct. Electrolytic cells drive nonspontaneous reactions using electricity. Learn more
